knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)

# How to use variables 

```{r Variable}

var_m <- "my first variable"

print(var_m) 
```

# how to get type of variable

```{r type}

typeof(var_m)
```

we can also use class() function


```{r class}

class(var_m)

```

# character data type

```{r char}

x <- "hitesh"

class(x)
```

# numerical data type

```{r numerical}

y <- 1234

class(y)
```

# integer data type

```{r integer}

z <- 66L

class(z)
```

# complex number 

```{r complex}

a <- 3+5i

class(a)
```

# logical 

```{r logical}

b <- TRUE

class(b)
```
